decks.notes: The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly by playing low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells, supported by card selection and cantrips to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal spells while maintaining card advantage through efficient card selection and manipulation. It relies on a combination of fast mana and cheap spells to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to control the board. Additionally, the deck has graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus and utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate to generate value from enter-the-battlefield triggers. The deck aims to out-tempo and out-value opponents by combining disruptive elements with aggressive threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to control the battlefield through efficient removal and combat tricks, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Joshua, Phoenix's Dominant to solidify its board presence. The deck prioritizes consistent damage output and maintaining a fast pace throughout the game, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out games swiftly. The inclusion of Static Prison and Voice of Victory adds additional versatility and protection to the deck's strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to establish a board presence early on with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage to the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional value and threats to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes some control elements with Static Prison and Elegant Parlor to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding, along with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to control the board and protect your creatures. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of colors for Tribal Flames and other multicolored spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful combo interactions between creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Basking Broodscale, along with equipment like Blade of the Bloodchief, to create a formidable board presence. With the support of cards like Ancient Stirrings and Kozilek's Command, the deck can efficiently search for and protect its key pieces. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End adds a devastating finisher to the deck's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its synergistic combo pieces and powerful threats.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo using cards that do not require lands to function. By utilizing cards like Beyeen Veil and Lotus Bloom to generate mana, along with key pieces like Thundertrap Trainer and Goblin Charbelcher, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of disruption spells like Jwari Disruption and Disrupting Shoal helps protect the combo while control elements like Stern Scolding and Spell Snare offer additional defense. Tameshi, Reality Architect serves as a finisher, providing a game-winning ability once the combo is in place.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Street Wraith, Force of Negation, and Living End to set up powerful combos and disrupt opponent's strategies. By cycling through creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Troll of Khazad-dûm and then casting Living End to bring them back onto the battlefield, the deck can create overwhelming board states and win the game quickly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Endurance and Subtlety to control the game and protect its combo pieces, making it a versatile and dynamic archetype in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying and utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Ragavan, and Phlage, along with support from cards like Goblin Bombardment and Guide of Souls to push for a fast-paced offensive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker helps control the board and disrupt opponents, while cards like Thraben Charm and Voice of Victory provide additional utility and support. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mixture of aggression and strategic plays to secure victory in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Infect combo deck is to quickly pump up your creatures with cards like Scale Up, Might of Old Krosa, and Vines of Vastwood, while also using infect creatures like Phyrexian Crusader and Plague Stinger to deal poison counters to your opponent. Additionally, the deck features protective and disruptive cards like Fatal Push and Royal Treatment to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The goal of the deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with poison counters before they can stabilize or mount a defense.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of instant spells and creatures with unique abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the game. By relying on a landless mana base and powerful combo cards like Disrupting Shoal and Goblin Charbelcher, the deck aims to quickly assemble its key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with unexpected plays and powerful abilities. The cards in the deck work together to create efficient and versatile plays, allowing the player to adapt to different situations and gain a strategic advantage over their opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to deal damage quickly, while also having answers like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury serves as a powerful finisher, while cards like Voice of Victory and Arena of Glory provide additional support for the aggressive strategy. The deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible by applying constant pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a win condition using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, while also disrupting the opponent with counter spells like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare. The goal is to control the game and prevent the opponent from developing a board presence, while setting up a combo finish with cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect. Without relying on traditional land cards, the deck aims to win efficiently through a unique combination of spells and abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to create a fast-paced, aggressive strategy using creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Supporting cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury add additional power and consistency to the creature base. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and maintain pressure. The mana base is optimized for quick and efficient access to the necessary colors for casting spells.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using a combination of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also utilizing powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, Static Prison helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Goblin Bombardment offers reach and removal. The deck aims to close out the game efficiently by leveraging its aggressive creatures and burn spells.
